actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that an individual over the age of 18 who is entitled to child's insurance benefits on the basis of disability shall not lose such entitlement by reason of marriage, regardless of the benefit status of the person such individual marries.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title II (Old-Age, Survivors, and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to provide that an individual over the age of 18 who is entitled to child's insurance benefits on the basis of disability shall not lose such entitlement by reason of marriage, regardless of the benefit status of the person such individual marries.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide that an individual over the age of 18 who is entitled to child's insurance benefits on the basis of disability shall not lose such entitlement by reason of marriage, regardless of the benefit status of the person such individual marries.
